name: Dart Dart Common Errors
description: Common Dart error patterns and fixes

rules.pattern: Null check operator used on a null value
rules.description: Using null check operator (!) on a null value
rules.suggestion: Add null checks before using the ! operator or use nullable types with proper null handling.

rules.pattern: (?:The argument type '.*\?' can't be assigned to the parameter type|A value of type '.*\?' can't be assigned)
rules.description: Null safety violation - attempting to assign nullable to non-nullable
rules.suggestion: Either make the target nullable, provide a non-null value, or use null-aware operators (?, ??, !).

rules.pattern: LateInitializationError: Field '(.*)' has not been initialized
rules.suggestion: Initialize the late field before accessing it or make it nullable with a default value.

rules.pattern: type '(.*)' is not a subtype of type '(.*)' in type cast
rules.suggestion: Use 'is' to check type before casting or use 'as?' for safe casting that returns null on failure.

rules.pattern: RangeError \(index\): Invalid value: (?:Valid value range is empty|Not in inclusive range)
rules.description: List or string index out of bounds
rules.suggestion: Check list length before accessing elements. Use .isEmpty or .length properties.

rules.description: Collection modified while iterating over it
rules.suggestion: Create a copy of the collection before iterating if modifications are needed, or collect changes and apply after iteration.

rules.description: Stack overflow due to infinite recursion
rules.suggestion: Check for infinite recursion, add base cases to recursive functions, or convert to iterative approach.

rules.pattern: (?:Invalid constant value|Const variables must be initialized with a constant value)
rules.suggestion: Ensure const values are compile-time constants. Use final for runtime constants.

rules.description: Attempting to instantiate an abstract class
rules.suggestion: Create a concrete implementation of the abstract class or use an existing implementation.
Provide all required named parameters when calling the function or constructor.
